pullRequest.body:

nodes.body:
Thanks!

bors d+

:v: xroblot can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7158671440/job/19491029366)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7158671440/job/19491029175)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7158671440/job/19491029249)

```suggestion
  refine ‚ü®fun h œà => h œÜ œà, fun h œÜ‚ÇÄ œà‚ÇÄ h' => ?_‚ü©
```
Can you weaken `IsAlgClosed` to being a normal closure of `E`? Or maybe we don't have the right setup/API for this yet?

Thanks for the review. I have pushed a new version that requires only normal closure. I had to add a couple of results about `IsNormalClosure`. I am not sure about `IsNormalClosure.algHom_equiv_algHom_isAlgClosed` since the equiv is completely non explicit so maybe I should just incorporate that in the proof of `IsNormalClosure.algHom.card` where it is used

Not sure `IsNormalClosure` is suitable here (it won't apply to the algebraic closure, for example). The right condition is that every minimal polynomial of `E` over `F` splits in `A`, which appears a lot in the NormalClosure file, and @acmepjz has [suggested](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/8117#discussion_r1381535021) making a def `IsSplitIn` for that.
Yeah, I think you are right. I'll refactor the code again.
Oops, that is indeed much better. Sorry for making an unhelpful suggestion first time round.
Do you still need this import?
I'll check the import (after I make the change suggested by Junyan).

```suggestion
theorem range_eval_eq_rootSet_minpoly_of_isNormalClosure [h : IsNormalClosure F K L] (x : K) :
```

I think it should be called `algHomEquivAlgHomOfIsAlgClosed`?

The `FiniteDimensional F K` could be replaced by `Algebra.IsAlgebraic F K` (however, the latter is not a typeclass so it can't be inferred from context automatically).

PS: Perhaps this result should easily come from [Field.embEquivOfAdjoinSplits](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/FieldTheory/SeparableDegree.html#Field.embEquivOfAdjoinSplits) (the `IsNormalClosure F K L` translates easily to the condition of that result) and [Field.embEquivOfIsAlgClosed](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/FieldTheory/SeparableDegree.html#Field.embEquivOfIsAlgClosed) (apply one forward and another one backward).

However, `Mathlib.FieldTheory.SeparableDegree` imports `Mathlib.FieldTheory.NormalClosure` but not the other way around, so I think you can't use that result here :(

I have pushed a new version using `Algebra.IsAlgebraic F K` and the splits hypothesis. In the end, I did not use the results from `SeparableDegree` to prove the equiv since I wanted it to be the natural one coming from the restriction to `L`. This implies that now I need to assume `Algebra L A`. The old version (without this assertion) can still be recovered since we can prove without this assumption that `(K ‚Üí‚Çê[F] L)` and `(K ‚Üí‚Çê[F] A)` have the same cardinality.
I think `of` should be `iff`, same as the next theorem.

```suggestion
  exact ‚ü®fun h => congr_arg (fun K : _ => finrank F K) h, eq_of_le_of_finrank_eq le_top‚ü©
```
(untested)
Is it better to write `F‚üÆŒ±‚üØ = ‚ä§ ‚Üî Function.Injective fun (œÜ : E ‚Üí‚Çê[F] A) => œÜ Œ±`? (untested)

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion [Algebra F L] [Algebra L A] [IsScalarTower F L A] ```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion theorem primitive_element_iff_algHom_eq_of_eval (Œ± : E) ```

(untested) Maybe you can write the last line as `(algebraMap E K).injective`
and combine these two lines as:
```suggestion
    exact minpoly.algebraMap_eq (algebraMap E K).injective Œ±
```
That works. Thanks!

I think this is more naturally stated asking that `L'` is an `L` algebra with `IsScalarTower`. You can surely produce `e` in one line then.

If you really want to keep this version we can also to that, but we want also the other one.
Thanks for the review. I added the version with `IsScalarTower` but kept the old version since it is the one I need later on.
Can you change `A` in `L`? Not very important of course, but...

```suggestion
@[simps]
def IntermediateField.algHomEquivAlgHomOfIsAlgClosed (L : IntermediateField F A)
```

```suggestion
```
Oops ;)
The name should mention `IsScalarTower` instead of `algHom`.
Good point. I changed the name to `splits_of_isScalarTower`
